text:
Absolutely terrible experience!!!!
My brother meet with an accident & was brought here by the ambulance . When we came in the receptionist was so racist, we asked her to open door n she would pretend she didn’t listen and would talk to her asian patients. I had to call security guy, who was next to her office to get in.
But the situation gets worst when my  brother was kept overnight and next morning too on the ambulance exit gate. The receptionist would come n say to move him but the hospital staff would keep him over there. Like where are the rules ? Not only my brother was in danger but also there were so many transfer happening from that door. The nurses and receptionist have 0 empathy & follow no rules , casually sitting using phone and ignoring patients. Can’t understand how can you leave someone overnight & for next day on this gate it self

Went to the emergency room at 3am, every nurse who treated me was very nice (better experience than Burnaby urgent care). My male caucasian doctor seemed like he was in a rush and didn’t really seem like he cares but I got the prescription I needed fairly quickly from him so I can’t complain too much. Wait time was 3 hours total from 4am-7am

While the ER is horrific and the treatment I received there two years ago still traumatizes me to this day; the daycare surgical procedures and MRI/CT appointments are phenomenal. I received wonderful care for my MRI, CT and other procedures at Richmond hospital. I had a surgical daycare procedure 2 weeks ago at Richmond Hospital and it was hands down the best care, my nurse even stayed with me after her shift time to help me meet the post surgery criteria so I could go home. Every nurse, clerk, tech, doctor, intern, student anesthesiologist and anesthesiologist who took care of me was AMAZING. The anesthesia team I had was particularly INCREDIBLE! Caring, patient and medical trauma informed are just some of the attributes I encountered. Also, the facility was quiet, clean and comfortable despite being on the older side.

I had a wonderful experience at Richmond Hospital. Every nurse, doctor, and staff member I encountered was highly experienced and professional. I received the best care throughout my time there, and I am incredibly grateful for their dedication.

I would like to give a special thanks to Medelene Kale and Teresa for their extraordinary support and care. Their kindness and expertise made a world of difference, and I felt truly supported during such an important time.

The birth experience at Richmond Birth Centre was exceptional, and I’m beyond thankful to have had such a positive experience.

During the night I spent there after the biopsy, the nursing care and attention were exemplary. Everything was done with precision, patience, and kindness. I am truly grateful for the excellent service provided. Your team’s compassion and professionalism made a difficult time much easier for me.

Came here for colonoscopy.

The Admitting staff is very helpful, efficient and patient. There was another patient impatiently raised the voice to them, but they stayed cool and ran through my admission effectively.

The colonoscopy reception lady was friendly and calmed me down to face the coming procedure that I hate.

There were two round of colonoscopy nurses: the 1st one checked and explained the procedure to me very clearly, from patient perspective; the 2nd nurse help to dressed me up (IV, bp set up), she was kind and professional.

In the procedure room, the two nurses and Dr. Nam Nguyen formed a very efficient team. Dr. Nguyen is top notch, and yet still spent time to explain clearly the results and what to do next.

I have a very good experience 5 out of 5. Although I’m not exactly like to be a “repeated customer”.

Absolutely appalling phone conversation with the paediatric maternity ward. I was trying to reach another healthcare provider and when I dialled their phone number it directed me to the paediatric maternity ward at Richmond General …

I wish I read the reviews about this hospital before coming here . I’ve been in the emergency for over 24 hours . They forgot to bring me my food, they also forgot to give me my pain meds in a timely manner . This is the worst experience at any hospital I’ve ever been too and I’ve been too dozens of hospitals . They’ve now moved me in a hallway after I was already admitted 24 hours ago.

Never thought reviews were a good idea for a hospital until my father was admitted to Rmd Hospital.  3 weeks in the hospital and no communication from anyone other than nurses who advise that they can't offer information.  Doctor does not call and is not available.  Have left multiple messages for the doctor to call, but nothing.  Very stressful.  Not sure about my next move.

Dr Hung treated my wife on a Friday night. Excellent doctor. She said if her condition deteriorates, for us to return to the same ER. 5 days later, my wife was running fevers of 40C and developed severe chest pains and could barely walk. We came back and were "treated" by Dr Stitt. This guy scolded my wife for coming back and not seeing her GP first. My wife was crying in frustration and asked for xray and bloodwork. He kept huffing and puffing  about why we were there and said we should just go see our family doctor (which would be 17 days at the earlier) Xrays were finally taken and my wife has severe pneumonia.

To Dr Stitt - thank you for being a shining example of why people dread coming in for medical care at Richmond Hospital. Another example of David Eby's NDP healthcare awesomeness.

We just want to compliment on the excellent care my elderly Mother received from your team at the Richmond General. All the Doctors and Nurses were extremely caring, dedicated and professional.
From Dr Wong at ER to Dr Ngai/Dr Khan's timely diagnosis on her meningioma swelling and other issues. Then to the entire nursing team at the Medicine Acute Unit.
A BIG shout out to Mark and Chantal at the unit who were so kind, patient and diligent with my elderly Mother, especially with her language barrier.
Mark was by (I swear) every 10-15 minutes on the first night to check on my Mother's vitals and ensuring her comfort.
Chantal was ever so accommodating and thorough with her craft in dealing with my Mother's various illnesses or issues.
Of course, we can not forget the equally top notch, first class care my Mother received from Jessica, Randy, Theresa and Lillibeth. Please accept my apologies if we missed anyone during these chaotic 2 weeks.
We will FOREVER be grateful.

I had my preoperative  appointments at Richmond General on June 24th.  Everyone was so professional and helpful.  I then had a partial knee replacement on July 5th with Dr. Kendall and stayed overnight.  All the doctors, nurses, physiotherapists and workers were exceptionally skilled, patient and kind.  The care I received was truly excellent!

You are better off risking death than visit this hospital. My mom and grandmother got off a cruise ship and my grandmother became ill. They took her to this hospital on a Saturday. She was diagnosed with influenza type A. A few IVs and Tamiflu and she would be on her way. Nope. The Dr took advantage of her being private pay since she was from the U.S. By the time she was discharged Monday for her flight home, she was diagnosed with low potassium, low magnesium, a kidney infection, UTI, kidney stone, blood infection, fluid in both lungs, and the doctor advised she stay for the entire week because all the tests they performed would take a week to come back......... even though they diagnosed her with all the above. My grandmother flew home and immediately went to her family Dr. A blood test, EKG, Ultrasound and x-ray showed there was absolutely no issues with her. Shame on this hospital and their doctors for putting an elderly person through so much bullshit. Let's not forget to mention they were extremely concerned with her oxygen level. Sooo concerned that when they brought her back from her ultrasound, they mistakenly never put her oxygen and pulse ox back on. 4 hours later when it was discovered, her O2 was 96. I'm not a Dr but 96 is normal and acceptable for a person above 80. Maybe I should apply to work at this hospital. I seem to know more than most.
If you feel ill, just take the risk of death. The bill they send you in the end will give you a heart attack anyways. Might as well risk the drive to go somewhere else!!

Just today I went in to get examined in the emergency department after my injury at work. The Doctor saw me and sent me for x-ray. Thank God there was no spinal fracture but just a soft tissue injury. She just told me I can go home and no further assesment. I was passing her a paper from my employer for occupational  assesment but refused and shooed me away. Saying it has to be done by primary Care or my family Doctor. Then turned around and left me. I was appalled and speechless and at the same time mad on how I was treated. I think that doctor needs to bw fired and shouldn't even become a medical practitioner. Lack of empathy, professionalism and straight up rude.

I'm from Surrey but come to Richmond General because I have an amazing surgeon that looks after me here, and I must say the nurses here are absolutely amazing compared to the other local hospitals. They care so much and are very passionate about their jobs and go the extra mile to make sure you're comfortable. I'm Trans and i don't feel discriminated against at all here, and that's a big deal. I've unfortunately been admitted to many of the local hospitals for various health reasons, and Richmond General has been the best, with St. Paul's a close second. If you are sick and need to go to the hospital, Richmond is the place to go. Though i will say you do need to treat the nurses and doctors with respect if you want to be treated with respect. You would think that's common sense, but not too many people have common sense anymore.

I attended for two pre-op tests on May 18/24  and a lovely volunteer named Brenda not only walked me to where I needed to go, she knew I had to come back a few days later for a third test so she inquired if they had room to fit me in that day and they did, thank you Cheryl in medical imaging. Also thanks to my xray tech Natalie who helped me remove and put my necklace back on. My blood test was a breeze and so was my ECG. I’ve never come across such friendly staff at a hospital, kudos to everyone for being so kind and professional.

Too long waiting time in Emergency. Understaffed just like all other hospitals in Canada. They gave me a pain killer to bear pain but the wait time just destroys your schedule and you think twice about visiting a hospital in pain but there is no other option. It’s not fair to people that there is no other option like a private clinic or hospitals. If government wants to have only 1 hospital per city they need more staff. Can’t believe this is happening in a developed country. If I were in India , I would have had 3-4 different options to immediately see a qualified doctor in any private hospital. Wouldn’t have been free but I don’t care about the money in pain, at least give me that option. Canada’s healthcare is terrible

Good service!
Surgery excellent!
Nice place!
Comfortable!
Staff friendly!
Emergency services very professional.
Clean and safe!

My care here on the maternity floor and recovery floor was great. Im forever grateful for the work that goes into the care I received from start to finish. I felt safe in knowing that my needs were addressed with mutal  respect and understanding.

I had a Good experience with the paediatric section of this hospital as my child needed IV and we were being sent to this hospital from bc children hospital.
The nurse kris Thibault was amazing super kind and responsible and very affectionate.
I am just sharing my experience about paediatric section and I don’t  know anything about ER or other sections

Yesterday I had a 4 hour stomach surgery at the Richmond hospital.  They are releasing me the today which is ok.  I’m still in a lot of pain the nurse has left 3 glasses of water on my tray and told me to drink them in a span of 2 hours. Apparently if I don’t pee she can’t release me, I told her my stomach hurts and I can’t drink that fast, she said you have 2 hours.  Also I have been told by the nurse that I won’t be getting a prescription for pain meds because I don’t need them, I told her I won’t be able to get through the night she said get a prescription from the pharmacy. She said phone around and find a pharmacy that will give you the prescription, so my husband phoned pharmacies and they said pain killers can only be prescribed by your doctor.  I feel so upset, I can barely walk and she is so unpleasant and insensitive.  Such a horrible experience at this hospital.

Worst hospital ever. dont understand why the nurses are so rude and angry, I get the healthcare system puts a lot of stress on them but if u have no compassion or empathy then why r u working there?? Waiting area is so dirty, it’s just a mess. Go to any other ER.

I really don’t like to write reviews but this hospital is making me crazy, the waiting time is toooooo long!!! How it is possible? The nurse told me to go to a room, I was waiting for an hour then I asked a nurse nicely who was passing by, I said “hi, excuse me, I have been waiting here for an hour but the doctor didn’t come” she: “you didn’t wait that long” soooo mean! Later, another nurse change me to another room, and said “wait here.” Well, 3 hours and where is the doctor?
I really don’t know what they are doing, people are dying and they don’t care!

This morning I  went to Richmond Hospital for a pulmonary function test. My appointment was for 0930. I was asked to arrive 20 minutes earlier. I sat on that waiting room chair from 0910 to 0930 without a single explanation from any staff. The tech treated me so poorly that I was in tears. He was a rude, condescending, bully that schooled and scolded me for not being able to reach the result to his liking. After the last try he said" I'm tired, we're done. I cried and coughed so hard that I almost threw up

I had my MRI done early this morning at the MRI unit. The place was very organized and clean. The receptionist and the technician were exceptionally friendly, professional , patient and caring. Kudos to management . Thank you for your dedicated public service!
Ed
Went into the emergency room with some heart issues every single person I spoke to was helpful and kind amazing work from all of you

Don't ever go to this hospital. They tried to kill me for my money by giving me 6 sleeping pills every night and lying about it. They are holding me hostage. I feel trapped. I don't have any mental health issues and they are over medicating …

Parking is $1.75/ for half and hour
Staff are nice and experienced but just always long wait for service
Being really sick and still need to worry about parking really stressful …

I rarely write reviews, but when I do, it means that I really had a very great experience (dos equis, no pun intended).

My wife's water broke around noon of April 12, 2024. We rushed to Richmond Hospital and got admitted at their Birth Centre.

From admission all the way to discharge, everything were done with compassion and care.

I want to give thanks to the amazing team that took care of my wife and my baby.

To the team (Doctor and OR nurses) that did the C section- You guys are all amazing!

Nurse Madison who took care of us when we arrived.

Nurse Sheen- very friendly and at the same time professional

Nurse Melinda and Nurse Deborah- you guys are great and informative.

Nurse Wendy and Jody - Great team.

Nurse Aly- Gave us proper care all throughout her shift.

Nurse Heather- Her and Nurse Angela professionally managed my wife's pain when my wife's bladder got distended (due to catheter removal) and was giving her a one hell nightmare of pain.

Nurse Angela and Rav- The best duo. They made us feel that we were not in a hospital with their professional and at the same time friendly manner, plus all the hacks for taking care of the baby and pain management that Nurse Angela taught us. Nurse Rav made sure that we have all we need and checking on us whenever she's available.

Most of all, to nurse Kernix (I hope I got it her name right) who never leave us when my wife was in labor. She did even not want to leave our side even though her shift has already ended.

I can't thank you guys enough and hopefully me, my wife and baby Zaiden can visit you guys one of these days.

Thank you very much for the top notch care!

Thankfully the staff and doctors were super nice with me. The wait was not too long compared to other hospitals. However, things started to go south once I was inside.

The nurse couldn’t find my vein so she started to move the needle inside my arm which of course hurt. Since she couldn’t find it she used the other arm and started moving again. After the painful experience she said it was my fault because I had to be “relaxed”.

Then the doctor came and he was super nice and gave me the medication needed. The doctor said the pharmacy was going to contact me and that I shouldn’t do anything else.

A few days passed and the pharmacy never contacted me, so I called them. And they told me very upset that it was my responsibility to contact my family doctor for the rest of the medication. Which I would have done if the doctor didn’t tell to not do anything.

I’m grateful for the service but definitely last time I come here.
Racist. Uncaring. Judgemental. Wrong health care advice given. Impatient.  The nurses are the worst.  The doctors are just as bad. In 12 years of living here. I had one nice doctor.

Here for day surgery, had a decent experience! Was quite nervous about the operation, but the nurses put me at ease and were fun to chat with before and after. Forgot to bring a mask and thankfully they provided them at the main entrance. …

I’d say thank you to the birth center staff Kalin who comfort my anxiety and take care of me with patience when I have blooding during my 3rd trimester pregnancy and first time been Richmond hospital. I am so worry about my first baby ‘s situation, but she comfort me with professional. I ‘d like sending my compliments and appreciation for her.

Don’t know why ppl have bad experiences here and wait time for ER is long at every hospital..
I had hip surgery back in Feb, from surgeon till after care and check up with imaging dept and cast clinic, everyone is caring and patience.
If i told you a random lie right now then you would believe it. Thats how useless any and every reviews are. Use the hospital yourself and judge it by your own experience not someone else’s.

I want to say thank you to Nurse Ann from the ER. I called 11/5/23 to check the status of a family member and she gave all information we need kindly and professionally. You do not know how much comfort you gave our family! Your hospital is lucky to have you. Thank you to all the staff for taking care of Wilson.

Today, I visited Richmond hospital seeking urgent medical attention for severe nerve pain. Despite my distress and prolonged wait, my encounter at the hospital left me deeply disheartened and frustrated. Here's a recount of my experience:

After enduring almost four hours of waiting and pleading to see a doctor, I was finally attended to by Dr. S. FEDDER in the emergency department. However, to my disappointment, Dr. FEDDER's response to my condition was far from satisfactory. Despite my explanation of the intense pain and my belief that my lower disc had slipped causing compression on the nerve, ( had MRI done few days ago) Dr. FEDDER simply dismissed my symptoms as sciatica nerve pain. He asserted that there was nothing further they could do to alleviate my suffering.

Feeling desperate for relief, I requested morphine, a medication that had provided some comfort in the past. Shockingly, Dr. FEDDER callously refused my request, leaving me feeling helpless and abandoned in my time of need.

My experience at [Hospital Name] today has raised serious concerns about the effectiveness and compassion of Canada's healthcare system. It seems that the focus is more on managing symptoms with painkillers rather than addressing the root causes of patients' ailments and providing effective treatment options.

Furthermore, I must express my shock at the discrepancy between the medical advice I received abroad and the response I encountered in Canada. A top neurosurgeon in Dubai had recommended surgery to address the issue, emphasizing the importance of taking proactive measures before the situation worsened. However, the doctor in Canada seemed to have a vastly different approach, stating that surgery would only be considered if I experienced numbness in my private parts. This discrepancy in medical opinions has left me feeling confused and concerned about the quality of healthcare I received.
In conclusion, my experience with Canada's healthcare system has left me feeling more unwell than when I arrived. Today's encounter has left me deeply disheartened and disillusioned. I sincerely hope that sharing my experience will spark a reevaluation of healthcare practices and drive improvements in patient care and outcomes.

I got a C section in Richmond hospital. Overall, the experience was pretty good. The only thing I want to complain was that I met a disgusting and terrible nurse!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I was awake at that time, and my newborn baby was finally sleeping on my bed, after crying off and on for almost two hours. That nurse came in and asked me to put my baby in the crib box, and told me that is not safe to let the baby sleep on my bed. As I just got a C section, my wound is getting more painful, so firstly, I wouldn’t easily fall asleep; secondly, if the nurse really want their patient  to get more rest after the surgery, why she kept doing the opposite? I was awake at that time, that means I would not roll over and hold my baby down. After her “nice”visit, my baby started crying again, and I had to cuddle my baby again, tried to let him fall asleep, that means I can’t sleep again !!!!!!!!!!!! That nurse is super disgusting, super !!!!!!!!!

I have seen Dr's nurses and so on and I have no complains a bout my beautiful Richmond Hospital
To all stuff thank you for all you do.

Other than them being so short staffed which I emphasize with 8 hours in emergency was a challenge...but huge shout out to Dr.Sohie Low-Beer she was very kind and thorough was able to set me up to be comfortable to get back home to Penticton to see my doctor...thankyou to all the staff even short staffed you all are amazing 😁🙏 …

We recently had the privilege of giving birth at the Richmond Hospital Birth Center, and I cannot praise this facility enough. From the moment we stepped through the doors until the day we left with our precious bundle of joy, the entire experience was nothing short of exceptional. Here are just a few reasons why I rate the Richmond Hospital Birth Center with a resounding five stars:

Expert and Compassionate Staff: The staff at the birth center are an incredible team of professionals who genuinely care about the well-being of both the mother and the baby. From the highly skilled doctors and nurses to the friendly administrative staff, everyone went above and beyond to ensure that we felt safe, supported, and well-informed throughout our entire journey.
State-of-the-Art Facilities: The birth center boasts state-of-the-art facilities that are designed with the utmost comfort and safety in mind. The private birthing suites are spacious and beautifully decorated, creating a serene and calming environment. Each room is equipped with advanced medical equipment, ensuring that both mother and baby receive the best possible care.
The staff respected and supported our birth plan, providing personalized care that aligned with our preferences and values.
Excellent Prenatal and Postnatal Care: The care we received during prenatal and postnatal stages was exceptional. The hospital provided regular check-ups, informative classes, and support groups that helped us prepare for childbirth and navigate the early stages of motherhood. The dedicated lactation consultants were invaluable in helping us establish breastfeeding successfully.
Warm and Welcoming Atmosphere: Richmond Hospital Birth Center created a warm and welcoming atmosphere that made us feel at ease from the moment we arrived. The staff exuded kindness and patience, ensuring that my wife and I felt comfortable and supported throughout the entire experience. It truly felt like a home away from home.
In conclusion, my experience at the Richmond Hospital Birth Center was nothing short of exceptional. The expert and compassionate staff, coupled with the state-of-the-art facilities and holistic approach to birth, created an environment that exceeded all our expectations. I wholeheartedly recommend the Richmond Hospital Birth Center to any expectant parent looking for a safe, supportive, and memorable birth experience. Five stars all the way!

I would if I could give a negative star if possible. Very bad experience or feeling twice at yellow zone MRI receptionist,  she is very cold and reluctantly to work. She doesn't look at or check patients care card, she just let patients read the number and she has no motion while letting you reading the number.she looks very unhappy while working.
She threw the medical form to chair and left, didn't tell us to fill the form, we realized that we need to fill the form after 20 mins.
Shall she check patient med card and confirm the patient is correct people. And more, shall she tell patient to fill out a form instead  throw it to a chair and left? Are we supposed to get a basic service on Saturday morning?
Actually,  rest of the staff at MRI are very nice and professional,  her attitude is really downgrading others efforts.
I brought my daughter to Richmond Hospital Emergency Department as she has high fever for 5 days. …

I will expand this review once I wake up (feeling drowsy from the drugs I was prescribed— mind the incoherency, lol).

Went to the hospital at 3:20am to settle my COVID issues which were being provoked by my insomnia, which itself was being provoked by anxiety. I was in better shape than a number of patients checking in through triage, so I had to wait longer to see a doc (understandably so).

6 hours later, however, and I find myself in a small room and given some apple juice, a vegetarian cheese sandwich and a sample cup to pee in. If the food was a bribe to get me going to the washroom, it worked. I could tell right away I was extremely dehydrated— no fancy lab tests needed to know. The nurses take the near bronze tube in a bag for me. I have no idea what happened.

I start getting cold and the nicest nurse ever draped a blanket over me and dimmed the lights to the room so I could get a nap in.

Dr. Chao was the doctor I woke up too, and I appreciated his skills in scoping my needs while also accentuating that we will build a plan depending on the needs I stated for them that day. I start going into more psychology territory. The doc admits that the call-in psychiatrist would be of better help to me. I’m then lead out of the room by a nurse, and then to a stretcher bed. I was asked if I wanted food. I said yes.  and was presented with waters, orange juice, milks, creamers, and coffee. I jokingly wonder if the nursing team to get a homie hydrated.

I ended up taking a nap. When I wake up and have another tray of food, I’m greeted by Dr. Gill, the call-in psychiatrist contacted by Dr. Chao. He asks me a rather thorough set of evaluative questions regarding my mental health. He asks me what my biggest problems are now. And what kind of solutions do I want to see done. When I answer what I want, Dr. Gill confirms my placements with an Outpatient Psychiatrist to work with; then prescribes me some medicine to help me get to sleep, and lastly a pill that can take the edge off intrusive thoughts at night.

I took these medicines just an hour earlier, and I am feeling fiiiiiine— like I was being sank into my bed by an invisible bear; all the while, the volume of my thoughts puff into a mellow cloud. The clouds are there, but nothing really to be thought about.

Great feeling… hope it translates to a good sleep!

Thank you to the entire Richmond Hospital team for the compassion you share with your care, even with the constant stress you feel for the health of your patients. Thanks for all you do! 🤍✨

Great experience with my breast reduction surgery! Amazing doctors and nurses, everyone is so kind.
However. Despite the fact my roommate had come in to drop me off, and that several of the staff in the Surgical Day Care watched me hand my cellphone and items to him, and even telling the Staff outright that he was the person picking me up; the staff later accused him of being a unknown person, refusing to answer his questions about whether or not I was okay. They called him to come in an hour earlier, then got angry when he came in when called.
Great doctors, great care for those in surgical care, but I can’t give a hospital 5 stars for being so cruel to those that are there as emergency contacts. I will do everything in my power not to return to this hospital.

Indeed, the workers in this hospital deserve all respect. Indeed, they are kind to us. I was with my sick friend Nicholas. I do not forget the help of the staff, including doctors and nurses, especially the nurse named Sarah, of Persian origin, on the third floor (Zon Red). She was really great in her dealings with us.  We did not feel that we were in the hospital, we felt at home. She was really cooperative and provided assistance at all times. Really, thank you (Sarah) and the staff that is with you. You are a degree of morality and respect. Thank you.  (Adam)

Been here twice. One time in Emergency and another time in the Out Patient Lab. The Emergency visit was uneventful and even fast by Hospital standards. The Blood Lab was another story. Despite having an appointment and a Proper Dr’s …

If you are in severe pain and go to emergency that means you need urgent care but at Richmond hospital 6 to 7 hours wait with the pain it's like a nightmare. I rather prefer not to go to the hospital in emergency but in real emergency you have no any other option .In long waiting time you want to cry loud but nobody is listen to you Because you are in emergency .this is so horrible  ,people who have health issues they face nightmare in the name of hospital .

My grandpa was feeling intense pain around the pancreas and they took a ct scan for him, which costed around 2100 dollars, not counting the 1275 entrance fee because he wasn’t a Canadian resident. After that they made my dad pay a “consulting fee” without any written contract, which was another $1275. Please explain why, hospital? Watched a nurse kick a man out for being in pain on the ground from stomach pain. We waited 6 hours to see a doctor, my daughter kept chocking on thick yellow and brown phlem and had a lung infection. He took 10.seconds to.say shes fine, up …

Today my doctor called me about the other x ray I did at 4:30 that same day and I have pneumonia! What the heck ? The Dr also treated me like I was faking it

My husband and I are visiting from Michigan. He brought me to the Richmond Emergency Room at 7 PM on Saturday evening. We did experience a long wait but the ER was very busy. The entire staff, nurses, doctor, X-ray technician were very efficient, compassionate and all treated me with respect. It was a very positive experience.

richmond hospital made the worst time of my life alright. my grandmother, who raised me, is probably going to pass today. everyone in the hospital, the techs, the nurses, the phlebotomists, social workers, and of course doctors, were enormously helpful, humane, and caring. I've worked in the very best and renowned hospitals in the world and I will say that the culture of richmond hospital and the degree of compassion and morale here is palpably better. the gripes against the hospital must be reflective of the overall state of healthcare rather than the people inside. its clear the doctors are absolutely exhausted and the healthcare resources are always in short supply, but that is a systemic problem, not one specific to this hospital. granted, you won't have the state of the art fanciest gadgets or procedures done here, but they commendably uphold the standard of care and in the 21st century that is far more than sufficient. i would have no qualms passing here as well. go richmond hospital! you've earned yourself a fan!

Giving birth there was a horrible experience… anytime I was told to into emergency, it was terrible… now I need surgery and it’s already a terrible experience again. Staff lack empathy and guidance as well… …

My visit to the ER in 2022 gives me still ptsd. Was experiencing chest pains with leg pain at my workplace a public sector. We have a medical clinic and I rushed to see the doctor. Once at the ER the receptionist could care less about any information I had to share. Kept telling me have a seat. I sat down frightened ,waited 3 hours till finally called in for ecg, waited another 2 hours to be seen by a doctor who ordered a CT.

Before I did two times Breast cancer screening there that were good. Can’t say enough about my experience at the hospital. Everything was so organized and streamlined prior to my knee replacement. The staff are wonderful. Very efficient and professional. One of the patients in my room has had visitors coming and going all day long and at 9:05pm he still has 2.. Very annoying when I’d like to go to sleep!

It was more than a year ago which I accidentally sliced my finger while using a can opener. My finger began bleeding non-stop from the deep cut, so I called the ambulance but waited more than 2 hours.

Thank you for everyone who helped my mom recover. All the ER nurses(Jasmine, Joanna and
Anneka), 3North Surgical nurses(Joanna,Kim,Marvin and Christabel), PACU nurses(Rebecca) and doctors thank you! For people who complain, just be grateful! They are trying their best!

I have been emergency and admitted 5 times since beginning of the year and from the minute I come through the doors to going home my treatment is beyond comforting. The nurses,careaids, housekeeping and the doctors all have gone over and above with me.

I had a good experience with this hospital.
I came in on a busy Friday night and the doctor was great from start to finish, he walked me through everything which was really helpful because it was my first time in the emergency. The surgeon and nurses walked me through everything that was happening and put my mind to ease as I was quite nervous and had many questions.

We would like to express big gratitude to staff of Richmond hospital in ER unit for their wonderful service that my wife has received during our short trip to Vancouver. We were in and out of the ER in less in than 2 hours as opposed to 8 hours in other ER centres we previously experienced.  Once again thank you for your excellent, and efficient clinical services.

The absolute worst hospital. They're slow with no urgency and it appears that there are more nurses than Doctors available. A family member of mine has been there for nearly a week, most of that week he waited around for a doctor to show up …

I was here with my grandpa waiting 4.5 hours. We were seen by a friendly nurse but after that not one person came to inquire about how we were doing or to tell us the wait time. I understand that other people may have severe problems but they least they can do is keep us in the loop as my grandpa is experiencing severe pain. If possible drive to another ER DONT GO HERE.

I had an overall okay experience at Richmond Hospital. Although the waiting room was packed, I was seen within reasonable time by a doctor & nurses were friendly & made me feel comfortable. My only negative is I was given no medication for pain & I wasn’t given an emergency ultrasound as ordered by my doctor.

Staff are always kind when I come here. They want the best for you and want to understand what you are going through. It is just always a long wait if you are either outside waiting to go into a room or inside waiting for someone to come check on you - you need to be really patient. Once a staff does start talking to you, they are all friendly and wants what is best for you. The nurses are kind, one time I came really late at night and fell asleep, and a nurse put a hot blanket over me to keep me warm. Your information for why you are here gets around, so you do not need to repeat yourself to every single doctor/nurse/worker that comes to check on you as they already know from the other workers which makes it efficient. When I needed to get an x-ray back in March, the guy was super friendly and made me feel comfortable as he walked me down to the x-ray room and the doctor who gave me a sling had a great friendly personality which also made me feel comfortable. The front desk lady on the same night was super kind and made me feel calm as I was nervous to be there.

Had my first baby here late April. The entire staff at the birthing center was extremely friendly, professional and caring. There wasn't anyone I encountered who didn't care about their work. They made us feel extremely welcome, taken care …

I have a wonderful experience from this hospital . They examined me right away after I arrived at the emergency room! The Staff at Richmond Hospital are kind and efficient. I feel that the Dr's and nurses listened carefully to all my symptoms and did tests to cover all aspects. I would recommend this hospital. 100%
Our son was in for sutures. Started off at the critical care unit - they said they were too busy and told him to come to Richmond Hospital Emergency. Staff are great - courteous and professional. …

Our experience at the birth centre was amazing. I’m glad I gave birth at this hospital, staff are professional, friendly and supportive. From the doctors who delivered our baby to kitchen staff. Worst hospital that I ever visited in my life.They don't care about their patients. There is 6 hours waiting even for emergency.

Terrible service in emergency. Very bad service ever actually I was waiting there for 6 hours and already informed them that I have nerves pain which is very sticky but no doctor respect and response but I really one nurse or assistant she was very helpful and given pain Keller tablets and I left the hospital without and before to see doctor 😢 …

I made everyone aware I have anxiety and ptsd around surgery due to the loss of a child and hardly anything was done to make the experience more comfortable for me. Now it's been a couple days since my surgery and I am progressively getting more sore. I have charlie horses from the base of my skull down to my ankles. This did not happen to me after the last two surgeries I've undergone and I honestly feel like these people were so rough with me while I was unconscious.
Unless you enjoy cold, unpleasant, impersonal, uncaring, unfriendly, rushed staff that don't respect your mental health needs and who make you feel like a burden I absolutely do not reccomended Richmond General for surgery.

My very elderly father is currently in their care. My partner and I were quite impressed with the quality of care and kind professionalism of the staff. I can call for prompt updates from his nurse. The facility is also super clean and well organized. Compared to some hospitals I've visited in NYC this place is heaven.

What a complete joke at Richmond Hospital Emergency Services.  The wait times are horrendous . Over  8-9hours.  You see staff chatting and having fun while patients are in pain and agony and made to wait for hours! It is like we are at …

I waited with my dad at this hospital from 6pm til 10:30pm and still we haven't seen a doctor at the Triage Emergency. What a horrible experience! I would not recommend anyone to come here for an emergency.

I went in today to have a breast biopsy and couldn't have wished for a better Doctor. Thankyou  Dr. Dorothy  Matzinger. You are greatest.  And thankyou to the nurses in the room too. You made it so much better for me. All the best❤️

Had our baby girl delivered here in the Birth Center and it was a very pleasant experience with friendly and helpful team. I brought a friend to emergency yesterday and had to write this review. From the admitting staff to the triage nurse to the EKG staff and the ER nurses, particularly Charlotte and Lily and the ER doctor, Dr Juneau, all were incredibly kind, …

Mom has been in palliative care for about a week? In her condition, you’d expect a general level of humanity in the nurses or at least some more kindness. Day nurses are mostly that- amazing and overall attentive to the needs of my mom and …

I was admitted into the ER yesterday for heart palpitations which I thought were related to my first Shingrix shot a few hours earlier. We've also been to this hospital's ER several times in the last 18 months with my husband and he was treated well although wait times were very long to see the on-call doctors. For a first world country ,Canada’s health care system is a disgrace and nothing embodies this more than Richmond Generals emergency department. From the surly admitting nurses , to the excruciatingly long wait times, this hospital is skin to a joke.

I had two babies delivered at this hospital and both times everyone was amazing.  My mother had major surgery at this hospital and everyone was amazing. Absolutely the WORST emergency I have even been in Canada. At 6am on a Sunday, with 2 people in front of me.. still haven’t seen a doctor 3.5 hours later. Went there in need of emergency care. Waited an hour to check in, and then had waited a whole night, however no doctor came to see me and no nurse practitioner took care of us the entire time. Had to leave hospital in the morning without receiving medical care.

I owe my very being to these individuals; from emergency entry clerks, to nurses, doctors, support staff, etc. Before entry to hospital, the paramedics kept me going. David Kirkwood; O.G. Covid survivor.

Emergency staff from registration, triage, Pediatric nurses and doctors, X-ray staff were all very attentive, compassionate and helpful. Despite working in a stressful environment, they provided great care for my daughter. Shout out to Dr Mondor and Nikki our nurse who were both amazing!

My partner has been waiting in the ER, about to lose his thumb, and nobody has come to check on him. We have been here since 9 pm. It is now 11:45 pm and no sign of a doctor anywhere. I can see why this hospital has less than 3 stars.

Uodate: we ended up leaving.

My daughter and I waited in the Emergency room from mid night to 11:00am in the morning due to her allergy symptoms. The nurse gave us a room with bed at 3:00am but no further actions after that. Just back from from a major surgery to my leg that was performed at RGH and was treated wonderfully. My every needed was handled well, if I did have to buzz they came fairly quickly.
